distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated php packages that fix several security issues are now available for
Red Hat Application Stack v2.

This update has been rated as having moderate security impact by the Red
Hat Security Response Team.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
PHP is an HTML-embedded scripting language commonly used with the Apache
HTTP Web server.

A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in PHP's mbstring extension. A
remote attacker able to pass arbitrary input to a PHP script using mbstring
conversion functions could cause the PHP interpreter to crash or, possibly,
execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2008-5557)

A flaw was found in the handling of the "mbstring.func_overload"
configuration setting. A value set for one virtual host, or in a user's
.htaccess file, was incorrectly applied to other virtual hosts on the same
server, causing the handling of multibyte character strings to not work
correctly. (CVE-2009-0754)

A directory traversal flaw was found in PHP's ZipArchive::extractTo
function. If PHP is used to extract a malicious ZIP archive, it could allow
an attacker to write arbitrary files anywhere the PHP process has write
permissions. (CVE-2008-5658)

A buffer overflow flaw was found in PHP's imageloadfont function. If a PHP
script allowed a remote attacker to load a carefully crafted font file, it
could cause the PHP interpreter to crash or, possibly, execute arbitrary
code. (CVE-2008-3658)

A flaw was found in the way PHP handled certain file extensions when
running in FastCGI mode. If the PHP interpreter was being executed via
FastCGI, a remote attacker could create a request which would cause the PHP
interpreter to crash. (CVE-2008-3660)

A memory disclosure flaw was found in the PHP gd extension's imagerotate
function. A remote attacker able to pass arbitrary values as the
"background color" argument of the function could, possibly, view portions
of the PHP interpreter's memory. (CVE-2008-5498)

A cross-site scripting flaw was found in a way PHP reported errors for
invalid cookies. If the PHP interpreter had "display_errors" enabled, a
remote attacker able to set a specially-crafted cookie on a victim's system
could possibly inject arbitrary HTML into an error message generated by
PHP. (CVE-2008-5814)

A flaw was found in PHP's json_decode function. A remote attacker could use
this flaw to create a specially-crafted string which could cause the PHP
interpreter to crash while being decoded in a PHP script. (CVE-2009-1271)

All php users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain backported patches to resolve these issues. The httpd web server
must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: Buffer overflow in the imageloadfont function in ext/gd/gd.c in PHP 4.4.x before 4.4.9 and PHP 5.2 before 5.2.6-r6 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted font file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: buffer overflow in the imageloadfont function in gd extension
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: buffer overflow in the imageloadfont function in gd extension

notes.text: PHP 4.4.x before 4.4.9, and 5.x through 5.2.6, when used as a FastCGI module, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a request with multiple dots preceding the extension, as demonstrated using foo..php.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: FastCGI module DoS via multiple dots preceding the extension
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: FastCGI module DoS via multiple dots preceding the extension

notes.text: Array index error in the imageRotate function in PHP 5.2.8 and earlier allows context-dependent attackers to read the contents of arbitrary memory locations via a crafted value of the third argument (aka the bgd_color or clrBack argument) for an indexed image.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: libgd imagerotate() array index error memory disclosure
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: libgd imagerotate() array index error memory disclosure

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in ext/mbstring/libmbfl/filters/mbfilter_htmlent.c in the mbstring extension in PHP 4.3.0 through 5.2.6 allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted string containing an HTML entity, which is not properly handled during Unicode conversion, related to the (1) mb_convert_encoding, (2) mb_check_encoding, (3) mb_convert_variables, and (4) mb_parse_str functions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: Heap-based buffer overflow in the mbstring extension via crafted string containing a HTML entity (arb code execution)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: Heap-based buffer overflow in the mbstring extension via crafted string containing a HTML entity (arb code execution)

notes.text: Directory traversal vulnerability in the ZipArchive::extractTo function in PHP 5.2.6 and earlier allows context-dependent attackers to write arbitrary files via a ZIP file with a file whose name contains .. (dot dot) sequences.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: ZipArchive:: extractTo() Directory Traversal Vulnerability
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect PHP versions as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 2.1, 3, 4, and 5, and Red Hat Application Stack v1.
notes.title: Statement

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: ZipArchive:: extractTo() Directory Traversal Vulnerability

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in PHP, possibly 5.2.7 and earlier, when display_errors is enabled, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.  NOTE: because of the lack of details, it is unclear whether this is related to CVE-2006-0208.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: XSS via PHP error messages
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: php: XSS via PHP error messages

notes.text: PHP 4.4.4, 5.1.6, and other versions, when running on Apache, allows local users to modify behavior of other sites hosted on the same web server by modifying the mbstring.func_overload setting within .htaccess, which causes this setting to be applied to other virtual hosts on the same server.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: PHP mbstring.func_overload web server denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: PHP mbstring.func_overload web server denial of service

notes.text: The JSON_parser function (ext/json/JSON_parser.c) in PHP 5.2.x before 5.2.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a malformed string to the json_decode API function.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: php: crash on malformed input in json_decode()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect PHP versions as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 2.1, 3, 4, and 5, and Red Hat Application Stack v1.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
